alert.note: Alert for Clark; Greene (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 12 at 7:27PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF CLARK AND NORTHEASTERN GREENE COUNTIES THROUGH 800 PM EDT... At 727 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Springfield, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Springfield, Fairborn, New Carlisle, Yellow Springs, Wright-Patterson Afb, Northridge, Cedarville, Enon, South Charleston, Harmony, Lisbon, Donnelsville, Clifton, Green Meadows, Hustead, Selma, Gladstone, Medway, Buck Creek State Park and Springfield Municipal Airport. This includes I-70 in Ohio between mile markers 42 and 64. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
